TEI.2.document_title: Green DeWitt to Stephen F Austin, 03-03-1829

barker_notes.barker_summary: Green De Witt to Austin, March 3, 1829. Reporting depredations of Indians in his settlement and battle with Tahuacanas. Recommends appointment of Rangers to patrol the frontier.

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Green De Witt to Austin, March 3, 1829. Reporting depredations of Indians in his settlement and battle with Tahuacanas. Recommends appointment of Rangers to patrol the frontier.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Gonzales */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="03-03-1829">March 3rd 1829*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr Sir The *person_mentioned*indians */person_mentioned*have been commiting such outrages on the *person_mentioned*people of this *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, by killing a few hogs and stealing one horse; and robed the *location_mentioned*camp */location_mentioned*of some *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*who were sawing some plank *location_mentioned*3 miles above this place on the Guadalupe River*/location_mentioned*—the hogs were stolen below—*location_mentioned*on the River*/location_mentioned*, by the *person_mentioned*Tankawas*/person_mentioned*—, horse was stolen by the *person_mentioned*cados */person_mentioned*and taken from them again on the waters of the *person_mentioned*St Marcus*/person_mentioned* by a party of 19 *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*which I sent after them, the *location_mentioned*Camp */location_mentioned*above mentioned was robed by the *person_mentioned*Tawaccanies*/person_mentioned*—of about $100 worth of Tools— I sent a *person_mentioned*party */person_mentioned*of men out to find their course—after a march of 4 days on foot—they returned and reported that there were four in number—when they commited the theft, but were joined by about 25 more at the *location_mentioned*Cappoto*/location_mentioned*—and bent their course for *location_mentioned*LaBahia*/location_mentioned*, and crossed the *location_mentioned*San Antonio road 24 miles west of this place*/location_mentioned*—I raised a party of 17 *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*besides myself and followed them within *location_mentioned*about 15 miles of LaBahia */location_mentioned*finding on their trail parts of saws which they had broken which convinced us they were the same *person_mentioned*indians*/person_mentioned* there they had fallen in with a bout 40 more who had been encamped there during the last Storm, on that evening we struck their trail on their way from *location_mentioned*LaBahia */location_mentioned*with a Caviard of a bout 50 horses.—I put three *person_mentioned*spies */person_mentioned*ahead with orders to report should they see any *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*in a bout one hour, one of the *person_mentioned*spies */person_mentioned*discovered an *person_mentioned*Indian*/person_mentioned*— riding down from a *location_mentioned*prairie hill*/location_mentioned*; when he broke in to full speed without reporting what he had seen—he was too far ahead to hear me when I ordered him to keep order—consequently he went on and those who had good horses went on—others whose horses were tired were *location_mentioned*a mile behind*/location_mentioned*—when I arrived there were five *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*on the ground—and them scatered for the distance of two hundred yards— I ordered them to form *location_mentioned*in a small bunch of muskeet trees*/location_mentioned* in about 100 yards of the *person_mentioned*Indian */person_mentioned*horses—4 *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*besides myself formed there— when *person_mentioned*Capt McCoy*/person_mentioned* who was *location_mentioned*in the rear of me*/location_mentioned* order a retreat to better ground, and reported that the *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*were a bout to cut off our *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*who were on tired horses and intirely behind us—this put the *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*in confusion, and the *person_mentioned*indians */person_mentioned*having made a bold charge upon us with a hot fire—in order to cover their own *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*who were then securing their horses—*person_mentioned*John and Andrew Tumlinson*/person_mentioned* who had tied their horses in the edge of the same thicket where the *person_mentioned*Indians*/person_mentioned* were, got almost surrounded one of their horses being slightly hit by a ball, broke a way and joined our horses the other horse being tied with two hard knots, was siezed by an *person_mentioned*Indian */person_mentioned*in a few Steps of *person_mentioned*John T,*/person_mentioned* whose gun would not fire—the *person_mentioned*Indian */person_mentioned*untied the ho[r]se which got frightened at him; broke loose and Joined our *person_mentioned*company*/person_mentioned* the *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*followed those *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*a few yards and stopt, two of whom were shot down by our *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*They then retreated in to their thicket, carrying off their *person_mentioned*dead*/person_mentioned*—we were not able to charge in to their hold without great loss, as they were too superior in number—therefore we took our stand in the *location_mentioned*fork of a small creek */location_mentioned*in their view in order to draw them out—where we could be Sheltered by a few muskeet trees; where we remained for some time, but without any attack— we then with drew Slowly for a few hundred yards when we discovered them in full chase on horse back—we then took our stand and drove them with the loss of two more of their number; it then being after dark we Struck our course for *location_mentioned*home*/location_mentioned*; as I did not wish to hazard the lives of any the *person_mentioned*Citizen */person_mentioned*on such unequal grounds; for we were compelled to fight them at a place of [their] own selection; and which was almost impenetreble.*/p*
*p*I have given you this detail of the affair precisely as it was tra[n]sacted, in order to show you we were not the *person_mentioned*agressers*/person_mentioned*, but were persuing our property and were fired upon first by themselves. Your Old friend *person_mentioned*Don G. Flores*/person_mentioned* was robed of his horses*location_mentioned* between this and San Antonio */location_mentioned*and went home on foot as I am informed—. I have received information from *location_mentioned*Bexar*/location_mentioned*—that the *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*have stolen a great many horses from that place and that there are 200 *person_mentioned*Soldiers */person_mentioned*now in persuit of them. The fact is I believe the *person_mentioned*Caddos*/person_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Wacos */person_mentioned**person_mentioned*Comanches */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Tawaccanies */person_mentioned*are all concerned in the affair; and unless there is some precaution taken they will harrass the *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*on the *location_mentioned*frontiers */location_mentioned*of both of these *location_mentioned*Colonies*/location_mentioned*; and the only means will be to keep *person_mentioned*troops */person_mentioned*of some discription on the alert from the *location_mentioned*Colorado */location_mentioned*to the *location_mentioned*Guadalupe*/location_mentioned*, and thence to *location_mentioned*San Antonia*/location_mentioned* which would be the means of giving information of their approach and put people on their guard so that they could protect them selves and property. I would wish you to take these things in to consideration; and should you approve of the measure—use your influence to affect it, either by a*person_mentioned* Company of Rangers,*/person_mentioned* or the *person_mentioned*public troops*/person_mentioned* which would be a great security to the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*San Antonia*/location_mentioned* and *location_mentioned*LaBahia */location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*as well as to *location_mentioned*American Settlements*/location_mentioned**/p*.
*p*I have addressed a short note to the *person_mentioned*Alcalde at *location_mentioned*San Felipe*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* on the subject of the expected election at this place which is very much wished for and needed as well for the Organization of the *person_mentioned*Militia*/person_mentioned* as that of a *person_mentioned*civil officer*/person_mentioned* in this place which I hope you will urge as soon as possible, as our Safety greatly depends on a well Organized *person_mentioned*Militia*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Our place is strenghening fast, *person_mentioned*Mr. Lockhart*/person_mentioned* has arrived in the *location_mentioned*Bay of Aransas*/location_mentioned*—with 55 *person_mentioned*souls */person_mentioned**person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned**person_mentioned*women */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Children */person_mentioned*bound for this place; he himself has been up and returned to the *location_mentioned*Bay */location_mentioned*with Waggons Carts and horses for their transportation; and will arrive in a few days— I would be happy to hear from you; often and get the news of the day, and have your opinion on the best means and measures in case the *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*should prove hostile.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*G. DeWitt*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
